From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
CLIs: Note ! [ ] (/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)This command has been replaced by copy system:/running-config command.
To upload the current configuration to the network, use the write network command in privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Address of the host file to be uploaded.

Examples: IP address or name of host? mercury
Name of configuration file to write? system5.cfg
Upload configuration to system5.cfg on mercury (y/n) [ y ] ? y
ExtraInfo: The **write network** command cannot be used to upload software to the ATM module.

RelatedCmds.description: Copies files from a source to specified destination.
Displays the nondefault or module configuration information.
